content.description: It helps to be a mutant on this powerful and technical outing, as decent holds quickly evaporate into desperateness.
content.location: Beautiful oblique arete on the far right side of the monolith as viewed from the road.

content.description:
Totally Awesome unique climb! 

  This climb offers a variety of movement and some really unique moves.  Start in a pocket, work up and stick a blocky ledge.  There are a couple of decent rests at positive rails, but is sustained through the last few bolts.  FA November 2009
content.location: This route is located on the left side of the monolith when viewed from the road.  Hike up the short slope, this route begins about 15 feet right of the arete at the entrance to the corridor.
Obvious arete at the entrance to the corridor.

content.description: High-quality climbing up an immaculate face with a heartbreaker crux at the top.
content.protection: Five bolts to chains.  Stick clip bolt #1.
content.location: Obvious brown face in between Shattered and Wolverine.

content.description: Steep, bouldery start to easier climbing above.
content.location: Beautiful sculpted arete on the right side of the gun-blasted, graffiti-ridden front face.  Lots of broken glass at the base.

content.description: Garbage to glory: graffiti, bullet holes, and junk rock followed by a cool roof and a beautiful headwall with thin crimps.  Great climbing from midpoint up, but you pay a steep price to get there.  Barely one star.
content.location: Straight up the center of the monolith.  If you choose to climb this thing, take the extra precaution of keeping your rope and rope bag off the dirt - this area has been (and still occasionally is) used by losers as a dump site for scary things like car batteries.  Once, I had to discard a rope due to damage from invisible, but caustic chemicals.  When I belayed Harry, I built a platform out of rocks, put a crash pad on top of that, and put the rope bag and rope on top of that.

content.description: The detached block which forms the corridor
